verses.text: And upon the third day, when she had ended her prayer, she laid away \add her\add* mourning garments, and put on her glorious \add apparel\add*.
And being gloriously adorned, after she had called upon God, who is the beholder and saviour of all \add things\add*, she took two maids with \add her:\add*
and upon the one she leaned, as carrying herself daintily;
and the other followed, bearing up her train.
And she \add was\add* ruddy through the perfection of her beauty, and her countenance \add was\add* cheerful and very amiable: but her heart \add was\add* in anguish for fear.

Then having passed through all the doors, she stood before the king, who sat upon his royal throne, and was clothed with all his robes of majesty, all \add glittering\add* with gold and precious stones; and he was very dreadful.

Then lifting up his countenance that shone with majesty, he looked very fiercely \add upon her:\add* and the queen fell down, and was pale, and fainted, and bowed \add herself\add* upon the head of the maid that went before her.

Then God changed the spirit of the king into mildness, who in a fear leaped from his throne, and took her in his arms, till she came to herself \add again\add*, and comforted her with loving words, and said unto her,
Esther, what is \add the matter?\add* I am thy brother, be of good cheer:
thou shalt not die, though our commandment be general: come near.
And \add so\add* he held up his golden sceptre, and laid \add it\add* upon her neck,
and embraced her, and said, Speak unto me.
Then said she unto him, I saw thee, \add my\add* lord, as an angel of God, and my heart was troubled for fear of thy majesty.
For wonderful art thou, lord, and thy countenance \add is\add* full of grace.
And as she was speaking, she fell \add down\add* for faintness.
Then the king was troubled, and all his servants comforted her.
